decks.notes: The deck is focused on quickly reducing its own life total to enable powerful plays with Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler. It uses a combination of efficient removal spells, discard spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with its large threats. The deck aims to control the game early on and then quickly close out the game with a big swing in damage. It also has some interaction with countermagic and versatility with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Kolaghan's Command.

This deck focuses on quickly lowering your own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler. Utilizing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial, along with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the opponent's board while applying pressure. Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Snapcaster Mage provide card advantage and flexibility, while Temur Battle Rage enhances the deck's ability to quickly close out games with lethal damage. Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith help to enable the deck's strategy by providing card selection and life loss triggers.

The main idea of the deck is to control the game by using a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures like Geist of Saint Traft, Spell Queller, and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition using cards like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and allow for flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining board control and eventually overpowering the opponent with its strong threat options.

The key concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Farseek, while controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods. The main win condition is to use Scapeshift to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and then sacrifice lands to deal damage to the opponent with triggers from Valakut. The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces efficiently and disrupting the opponent's game plan to win the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Stinkweed Imp, triggering abilities like Dredge to bring them back to the battlefield. Utilizing cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam to deal damage to the opponent while building up your board presence. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a constant stream of creatures and powerful graveyard synergies, using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Life from the Loam to keep the engine going. This deck aims to be fast and efficient in setting up its combos and overwhelming the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Sakura-Tribe Scout, and leverage that mana into playing powerful threats like Primeval Titan. The Amulet of Vigor provides additional value by untapping lands when they enter the battlefield, allowing for even more mana acceleration. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands like Cavern of Souls and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator adds a combo element to the deck by utilizing cards like Engineered Explosives and Walking Ballista to control the board.

This deck focuses on using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. It includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck aims to maintain board control with cards like Supreme Verdict and Path to Exile, while also generating card advantage with draw spells like Opt. The win condition is typically through incremental advantage and using equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine to close out the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the pace of the game by disrupting opponent's strategies with cards like Blood Moon and Pillage while ramping up your own resources with Utopia Sprawl and Birds of Paradise. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and pressure the opponent with strong creatures like Stormbreath Dragon and Glorybringer. Additionally, it utilizes Chandra planeswalkers for additional board control and pressure. The mana base is optimized for consistent ramp and color fixing to support the spells and creatures in the deck.

The key focus of this deck is to quickly cycle through your creatures with cards like Street Wraith and Monstrous Carabid, fill your graveyard with powerful creatures, and then use cards like Demonic Dread and Violent Outburst to cascade into Living End, which will bring all your creatures back onto the battlefield from the graveyard. This allows you to overwhelm your opponent with a sudden influx of creatures, especially powerful ones like Archfiend of Ifnir and Horror of the Broken Lands, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Fulminator Mage and Beast Within.

The main concept of this deck is synergy between Elementals and control elements, utilizing cards like Risen Reef to generate value and Thunderkin Awakener to recur impactful creatures. Aether Vial provides mana acceleration and allows for instant-speed creature deployment, while Unsettled Mariner and Voice of Resurgence disrupt opponents' spells. Lightning Skelemental is a powerful finisher, and Vesperlark can bring back key creatures from the graveyard. The mana base is specifically built to support the Elemental tribal theme, ensuring smooth and consistent gameplay.

The deck focuses on using Jeskai Ascendancy to loop through spells and creatures in order to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards, allowing for explosive plays and combos to win the game quickly. The deck utilizes a combination of cantrips, mana dorks, and Glittering Wish to find and assemble the pieces needed to go off, while also including interaction and protection spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By leveraging the synergy between Jeskai Ascendancy and its supporting cards, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through its combo potential.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play and control the board with efficient removal spells and disruption while also utilizing the powerful death's shadow mechanic to quickly close out the game. By lowering their own life total with cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize, the deck can play a massive Death's Shadow early in the game and swing for a large amount of damage. Snapcaster Mage also allows for additional value by casting spells from the graveyard. This deck aims to apply pressure and end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck revolves around using spells with suspend mechanics to delay opponents and set up for a powerful board state. By casting spells with As Foretold and Electrodominance, players can quickly fill the board with creatures and overwhelm their opponent before they have a chance to recover. The combination of suspend spells like Ancestral Vision and Greater Gargadon with Cascade spells like Restore Balance allows for a balanced and unpredictable gameplay experience, keeping opponents on their toes and forcing them to react to constantly changing board states.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around using artifacts and creatures that interact with +1/+1 counters, such as Hangarback Walker and Arcbound Ravager, in combination with the Hardened Scales enchantment. By playing low-cost creatures and utilizing counters effectively, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with powerful, buffed-up creatures. The inclusion of cards like Animation Module and Scrapyard Recombiner further enhance the synergy of the deck, making it a formidable Aggro archetype in the Modern format.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and disrupting the opponent's game plan with Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. By utilizing Eldrazi Temple and the Urza lands for mana acceleration, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. With the ability to tutor for specific artifacts using Expedition Map and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck is versatile and adaptable to different matchups, while also having access to powerful board wipes like All Is Dust to clear the way for its creatures to dominate the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with key cards like Creeping Chill, Life from the Loam, and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Shriekhorn and Cathartic Reunion to quickly dredge through the deck, the goal is to bring back multiple creatures like Bloodghast and Narcomoeba from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent. Conflagrate serves as a finisher by dealing damage equal to the number of cards in hand and can be discarded easily using Dredge cards. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, putting pressure on the opponent early on.
